intro: Tachibota guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan tachibota, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Amazon Basin and other tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Tachibota guianensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
